> I tried to use  DirectorySuiteBuilder to have a Suite Builder/runner, 
> whose input would be to take package name and the test filter class, 
> based on these params, it should search for all valid testcase in the 
> same package as well all the subpackages and run the tests.

The idea is to give the root directory and use a TestFilter to filter the
classes that must be included.

        DirectorySuiteBuilder builder = new DirectorySuiteBuilder();
        TestFilter filter = new SimpleTestFilter() {
            public boolean include(String classpath) {
                return super.include(classpath) && 
                    SimpleTestFilter.getPackageName(classpath).contains("sun.xyz");
            }
        };
        builder.setFilter(filter);

this will include all files ending by "Test" and in the package sun.xyz and
subpackages.  IIRC SimpleTestFilter.getPackageName returns the path
(build/classes/sun.xyz) and not the classpath (sun.xyz).  This is clearly
something that should be done.  But noone complained so far :-)

> This runner 
> should extract the tests either from jar file package or file system 
> class in a transparent way unlike two separate classes as in 
> JUNIT-ADD-on i.e DirectorySuiteBuilder  and ArchiveSuiteBuilder..

That was an option for the DirectorySuiteBuilder but do you have tests packed in
a jar in the same location you have the classes of your tests?  I never have
this situation that's why I haven't implemented it.
